alert.note: Alert for Crisp; Dodge; Wilcox (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 5:21PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Dodge, southern Pulaski, Wilcox, southeastern Dooly and Crisp Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 521 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Ocmulgee Banks to near Tippettville to near Arabi, and moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Cordele, Eastman, Vienna, Rochelle, Arabi, Pineview, Pitts, Union, Richwood, Seville, Ocmulgee Banks, Finleyson, Pleasant View, Tippettville, Raines, Double Run, Wenona, Godwinsville, East Crisp, and Fort Early. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central and west central Georgia.
